title.rendered: Find Rooms for Rent in Spokane

content.rendered:
Famously known as the Lilac City, Spokane can be described as bustling and charming. Situated in the eastern Washington, the city experiences extreme winters and summers but the climate is pleasant overall, thanks to its low humidity levels. It’s a place where you can be surrounded by nature without having to travel far, or you can enjoy the luxuries of a big city with only a short drive. If you’re looking for apartments for rent in Spokane, WA you have come to the right place! Roomi will guide you through the activities, culture, lifestyle, and cheap rooms for rent in Spokane. Let’s not wait any longer and jump right into life in Spokane and help you look for rooms for rent in the Lilac City.

Getting to know Spokane

With a river running through the city, and with the variety of landscapes on offer, Spokane stands as the city that provides bountiful green space and natural beauty to all its residents. The city is a hub of museums, music, food and culture. If you’re looking for a place to live which combines the lifestyle of a city and provides easy access to nature (because who wants to travel for their nature fix?), then Spokane could be the perfect fit for you!

Finding rooms for rent in Spokane

Find Rooms For Rent In Spokane

Spokane offers a lot of perks to the people who want to live and work here, which keeps attracting more and more people to the city. Over the past few months, the average rent in Spokane is $1,095 per month, with an increase of 6% when compared to last year.

Neighborhoods with cheap rooms for rent in Spokane include North Hill, Manito – Cannon Hill, and Rockwood, where the average rent can be between $790/month- $850/month.

Neighborhoods with rooms for rent in Spokane with higher prices include Riverside, Peaceful Valley, and West Central Spokane with an average rent of $1,335/month.

Related: Looking for a roommate? Here are some qualities to look for!

Top neighborhoods in Spokane

Browne’s Addition: Browne’s Addition is an up-and-coming neighborhood in Spokane that offers many reasons for people to move there. With its close proximity to downtown and easy access to basic amenities, it’s no wonder so many people are choosing this area over other neighborhoods in Spokane, making it one of the top neighborhoods to get the best rooms for rent in Spokane.

Downtown: Also known as the Riverside, Downtown Spokane is regarded as the hub of all cosmopolitan needs and big city experiences. Whether you’re looking for something new and exciting or just want a quiet place to relax, Downtown Spokane has it all. With tons of great restaurants and bars, you’ll never run out of things to do here!

Emerson-Garfield: Emerson-Garfield is a great place to live if you’re looking for a neighborhood that’s in the middle of everything. The community has access to several different parks and trails, including the Centennial Trail, which runs along the Spokane River. If you’re looking for a neighborhood with affordable, and even luxurious houses, then this is the place for you! Emerson-Garfield can provide you with stunning, yet cheap rooms for rent in Spokane.

Average rent in Spokane

University life in Spokane

Students looking for a life in a city with diverse culture, adventure, entertainment, and easy access to nature should consider getting rooms for rent in Spokane. Spokane is the home to the University District, which includes two med schools and many higher education institutions. Here are the top 5 universities to check out!

Top Universities in Spokane

  • Gonzaga University
  • Whitworth University
  • Spokane Community College
  • Carrington College
  • Eastern Washington University

How transit friendly is Spokane?

If you have decided on looking for rooms for rent in Spokane and are now worried about the transit system, then we’ve got you covered. The average commute time for Spokane residents is just 20 minutes, which means you don’t have to spend all day stuck in traffic. Even though driving a car is the primary mode of transit in Spokane, the streets of Spokane accommodate other modes as well.

1. Taxis in Spokane

Taxis are the go-to transport method in times of need. Taxi services in Spokane are affordable and are the best option if you are in a hurry or it’s after midnight. There are various taxi companies, as well as Uber and Lyft available in Spokane, but it’s advised to book taxis in advance for longer rides.

2. Walkability in Spokane

As a part of their daily routine, many residents and visitors choose to walk in Spokane.  Thanks to sidewalks, crosswalks, curb ramps, etc., transit by walking is generally easy and safe in Spokane. When you’re out looking for rooms for rent in Spokane, we recommend going on foot and taking in the sights!

3. Public transportation in Spokane

Public transportation is the central key to transportation for residents working and studying in Spokane. Buses are available to the residents all year round, from 5:30 AM to 11:30 PM on weekdays and from 8 AM to 8 PM on weekends. Single-ride fare for buses is $2.00 (each way), and monthly passes are available for $60. There are software, apps, and technology on offer that make traveling on buses easy, like Text Your Stop, Real-Time Info Map, and Transit Apps. Those who are looking for rooms for rent in Spokane should definitely try Spokane buses!

Related: Top 8 Most Common Excuses For Not Having a Personal Budget

Cultural activities in Spokane

1. Skiing and snowboarding

If you’re into skiing and looking for rooms for rent in Spokane, then you might want to give the city a plus point because it’s home to Mount Spokane Ski & Snowboard Park, which is just an hour drive away from Downtown. They also have night skiing over the week, which makes it even better.

2. Theatre

Spokane is home to The Bing Crosby Theater, originally built as a silent film movie house but now home to all kinds of shows from live dance, movie, music, theatre, and other forms of arts. The Bing Crosby Theater is something you should put on your bucket list to check out in Spokane!

Restaurants in Spokane

Famously known as a top foodie destination, Spokane provides an exciting variety of food experiences for its residents. For all the foodies looking for rooms for rent in Spokane, this is your chance to learn about the best restaurants to dine in.

  • Casper Fry– Try this family-owned cafeteria for delicious and mouth-watering Southern cuisine with a modern twist.
  • Clover– Situated near the Gonzaga University,  this restaurant offers fresh seasonal cuisine dishes and amazingly crafted cocktail drinks.
  • Sushi.com– Considered to be home to the best sushi in Spokane, this restaurant has been serving authentic, fresh sushi for many years. Get a clear view of the sushi chefs from the bar, and savor your meal in the classy dining area.

We’ve got your back!

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find rooms for rent in Spokane? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match!

DOWNLOAD THE APP NOW!
